adverbs.description: abstractedly (comparative more abstractedly, superlative most abstractedly)

entries.meaning: In an abstracted manner; separately; in the abstract. [First attested in the early 17th century.]
examples: Doubtlesse, in the Idaea, or mentall shape before it come as it were into act, by beeing painted, cut, or carued, those terminating, and truly Mathematical lines, abstractedly considered, are manifest, adhering (or inhering rather) without any possibility of separation from the conceaued Image.

entries.meaning: With absence of mind [From the early 19th century.].
examples: Leaning abstractedly over a hogshead of tallow, her dark dishevelled tresses waved in opposite directions, and a Muse (as she was) appeared to vulgar eyes, a Fury!
